message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of selecting winners from a population of candidates, which is a common topic in game theory (cs.GT) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of dice and probability distributions also suggests a connection to probability theory and statistics (cs.IT). The feasibility constraints and matroid structure mentioned in the abstract are related to optimization and algorithms (cs.DS), while the study of efficient algorithms for constructing winner-selecting dice falls under machine learning and optimization (cs.LG).
